subject: Using TestSuite inside junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(suite())
msgSnippet: IDE: NetBeans 3.6 JUnit: junit3.8.1 Here s my test case (minus individual tests): package test; import junit.framework.*; import junit.swingui.TestRunner;
messageBody:
IDE: NetBeans 3.6
JUnit: junit3.8.1

Here's my test case (minus individual tests):

package test;

import junit.framework.*;
import junit.swingui.TestRunner;
import scwcd.display.InfoRequestStore;

public class InfoRequestStoreTest extends TestCase {

private InfoRequestStore store;

public InfoRequestStoreTest(String testName) {
super(testName);
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(InfoRequestStoreTest.class);
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
//junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(suite());
//junit.awtui.TestRunner.run(suite());
junit.swingui.TestRunner
.run(InfoRequestStoreTest.class);

}
}

The two commented-out lines in main() do not work. The
uncommented line is ok. When I try to compile I get
the
error message:

"run(java.lang.Class) in junit.swingui.TestRunner
cannot be applied to (junit.framework.Test)"

From the old messages that I've read it seems that
this is the ClassCastException - a Test cannot be cast
to a TestSuite from the TestRunner classes in
junit.swingui and junit.awtui. There is no problem
when using junit.textui.TestRunner.

Two questions arise in my mind:

1. I've read javadocs for all 3 TestRunner.run()
methods and I see no difference. Am I missing some
subtle point about the design of these three methods?

2. Is there a solution? I've read the old messages and
followed the recommended procedure by editing
excluded.properties but to no effect.

Cheers.
